update.description:
Fixes the failing gazebo\_ros\_pkgs barrel distortion test: [https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo\_ros\_pkgs/issues/681](https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/issues/681)

It appears that we weren’t recomputing the distortion scale when the “crop” setting was changed, so if crop was set to false, the changes weren’t ever propagated.
update.title: Fix gazebo_ros_pkgs barrel distortion test

content.raw: yeah, that's better
content.html: yeah, that's better

content.raw: how about now? I updated them
content.html: how about now? I updated them

content.raw:
![nocrop.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/2932170956-nocrop.png 'nocrop.png')![cropped.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/3045773736-cropped.png 'cropped.png')

Here’re the images from the original test. I manually forced the cropping to be false when producing the first image.

I think SetCrop\(false\) somehow didn’t work. I verified that it did get called and a different scale was set but it didn’t have an effect.

‌
content.html:
Here’re the images from the original test. I manually forced the cropping to be false when producing the first image.

I think SetCrop(false) somehow didn’t work. I verified that it did get called and a different scale was set but it didn’t have an effect.

‌

content.raw: those images don't work for me
content.html: those images don't work for me

content.raw: Does it still appear black after adding a light to the world? `model://sun` adds a light to the world.
content.html: Does it still appear black after adding a light to the world? model://sun adds a light to the world.

content.raw: Good idea! Still unable to produce a case where I see a border, but I don’t really know what distortion values would do that. Couldn’t figure out getting checkerboard but I put in a sky and a box. This is the image from the uncropped camera \(pixel by pixel same as cropped\). ![2.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/4110852343-2.png '2.png')
content.html: Good idea! Still unable to produce a case where I see a border, but I don’t really know what distortion values would do that. Couldn’t figure out getting checkerboard but I put in a sky and a box. This is the image from the uncropped camera (pixel by pixel same as cropped).

content.raw:
It looks like you are testing in an empty world, so it may be that both are completely gray.

Try spawning a `model://checkboard_plane` in front of where the cameras are looking.
content.html:
It looks like you are testing in an empty world, so it may be that both are completely gray.

Try spawning a model://checkboard_plane in front of where the cameras are looking.

content.raw: maybe you can test with the same setup in normal gazebo and check the topic viewer to see if the actual images are different?
content.html: maybe you can test with the same setup in normal gazebo and check the topic viewer to see if the actual images are different?

content.raw: Can you post a snippet of your test somewhere?
content.html: Can you post a snippet of your test somewhere?

content.raw: Huh I’ve set the test up, creating two cameras with identical pose and parameters but call SetCrop\(false\) on one of them, yet the image comparisions show there is no difference in the images. I’ve confirmed in gdb that their distortionScales are different, but the images coming in are the same. Any ideas?
content.html: Huh I’ve set the test up, creating two cameras with identical pose and parameters but call SetCrop(false) on one of them, yet the image comparisions show there is no difference in the images. I’ve confirmed in gdb that their distortionScales are different, but the images coming in are the same. Any ideas?

content.raw: Good idea! I’ll go with that.
content.html: Good idea! I’ll go with that.

content.raw: we do a bit of simple pixel comparisons in our camera sensor integration tests. We can see if SetCrop\(true\) reduces the number of black pixels, i.e. removes the black border
content.html: we do a bit of simple pixel comparisons in our camera sensor integration tests. We can see if SetCrop(true) reduces the number of black pixels, i.e. removes the black border

content.raw: I was thinking of adding this to the CheckDistortion test in test/integration/camera\_sensor.cc. Call SetCrop\(false\), verify distortion is valid, set SetCrop\(true\), verify it is still valid.
content.html: I was thinking of adding this to the CheckDistortion test in test/integration/camera_sensor.cc. Call SetCrop(false), verify distortion is valid, set SetCrop(true), verify it is still valid.

content.raw:
The quickest way to test would probably be to pull the `scale` parameter in the Ogre Shader, but that’s kind of a hack.

The `Distort` method doesn’t expose any testable information about the crop right now, and I think that changing that could potentially disrupt how that method is currently being used elsewhere.
content.html:
The quickest way to test would probably be to pull the scale parameter in the Ogre Shader, but that’s kind of a hack.

The Distort method doesn’t expose any testable information about the crop right now, and I think that changing that could potentially disrupt how that method is currently being used elsewhere.

content.raw: Okay, targeted to `gazebo8`.
content.html: Okay, targeted to gazebo8.

update.description:
Fixes the failing gazebo\_ros\_pkgs barrel distortion test: [https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo\_ros\_pkgs/issues/681](https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/issues/681)

It appears that we weren’t recomputing the distortion scale when the “crop” setting was changed, so if crop was set to false, the changes weren’t ever propagated.
update.title: Fix gazebo_ros_pkgs barrel distortion test

content.raw: see pull request #2678 for where this code was originally added
content.html: see pull request #2678 for where this code was originally added

content.raw: Ok, I think we should try to match this code and target it to `gazebo8`. If it's possible to squeeze in a quick test, that would be great too. I can ask @kev-the-dev if he is up for it.
content.html: Ok, I think we should try to match this code and target it to gazebo8. If it's possible to squeeze in a quick test, that would be great too. I can ask @kev-the-dev if he is up for it.

content.raw:
Good catch, that's exactly what it is. That's essentially the same logic
with an additional check for the flip before actually recomputing.
content.html: Good catch, that's exactly what it is. That's essentially the same logic with an additional check for the flip before actually recomputing.

hm...I wonder if we just had a bad merge from 7 -> 8

there is different logic in 7:

  • #!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2678/pincushion-distortion-model/diff#Lgazebo/rendering/Distortion.ccF289T359
 //////////////////////////////////////////////////
 void Distortion::SetCrop(bool _crop)
 {
-  this->dataPtr->distortionCrop = _crop;
+  // Only update the distortion scale if the crop value is going to flip.
+  if (this->dataPtr->distortionCrop != _crop)
+  {
+    this->dataPtr->distortionCrop = _crop;
+    this->CalculateAndApplyDistortionScale();
+  }
 }

content.raw: @iche033 any ideas for how to set up a test that shows the bug that is fixed by this patch?
content.html: @iche033 any ideas for how to set up a test that shows the bug that is fixed by this patch?

content.raw:
In the gazebo_ros_pkgs issue, I noted that the failure occurs on gazebo8. So I tested this patch on top of the gazebo8 branch and it fixed the barrel distortion test.

It would be nice to add a gazebo test if possible to capture this failure.
content.html:
In the gazebo_ros_pkgs issue, I noted that the failure occurs on gazebo8. So I tested this patch on top of the gazebo8 branch and it fixed the barrel distortion test.

It would be nice to add a gazebo test if possible to capture this failure.
